properties.title: Properties
properties.selectOperation: Select an operation to view properties

tooltips.boardSize: The calculated total dimensions of all loaded files.
tooltips.originOffset: Preview a new X/Y origin. Click 'Apply Origin' to save this position as the new (0,0).
tooltips.boardRotation: Apply a rotation (in degrees) to all operations around the current origin.
tooltips.center: Preview the origin at the center of the board's bounding box.
tooltips.bottomLeft: Preview the origin at the bottom-left corner of the board's bounding box.
tooltips.applyOrigin: Saves the current previewed offset as the new permanent origin (0,0) for the project.
tooltips.resetUnsaved: Discards any unsaved origin offset changes and reverts to the last saved origin.
tooltips.applyRotation: Applies the specified rotation to all geometry.
tooltips.resetRotation: Resets the board rotation to 0 without changing the origin position.

tooltips.pcbThickness: The total thickness of your PCB material (e.g., 1.6mm). Used for cutout depth calculations.
tooltips.safeZ: Maximum safe height for rapid moves and tool changes (G0). Must clear all clamps and fixtures.
tooltips.travelZ: Height above the board (Z=0) where the tool travels between cutting paths.
tooltips.rapidFeed: The feed rate (mm/min) for G0 rapid movements (travel and safe Z moves).
tooltips.postProcessor: Selects the G-code dialect for your specific CNC controller (e.g., GRBL, Marlin).
tooltips.gcodeUnits: Sets the units for the exported G-code file (G21 for mm, G20 for inches).

tooltips.grid: Toggle the visibility of the canvas grid.
tooltips.wireframe: Render all geometry as thin outlines instead of filled shapes.
tooltips.boardBounds: Show a red box representing the total size of all loaded files.
tooltips.fusionMode: Merge all overlapping isolation/clearing geometry into a single object. Required for Arc Reconstruction.
tooltips.preprocessed: Shows the geometry *after* fusion but *before* arc reconstruction.
tooltips.arcReconstruction: Attempt to rebuild arcs from line segments in fused geometry. Requires Fusion Mode.
tooltips.verboseDebug: Show 'debug' level messages in the status log panel.

status.default: Ready - Add PCB files to begin
status.logHint: Click here to expand log panel
status.logHintViz: Toggle verbose debug messages in the Viz Panel

messages.noOperations: No operations loaded. Add PCB files to begin.
messages.noOpsReady: No operations ready. Generate previews first.
messages.noGcodeToExport: No G-code to export. Click 'Calculate Toolpaths' first.
messages.opsMissingPreview: Operations missing Preview: {names}. Please generate previews first.

welcome.title: Welcome to EasyTrace5000
welcome.subtitle: Advanced isolation routing for PCB manufacturing
welcome.exampleHelp: Select an example to explore functionality.

gcode.title: Toolpath Manager & Export
gcode.orderHelp: Drag operations to reorder. Operations will be processed in this sequence.

tooltips.order: Drag and drop operations to set the final cutting order.
tooltips.exportSingle: Combine all selected operations into one G-code file. If unchecked, you will get one file per operation.
tooltips.includeComments: Add human-readable comments (e.g., '; Starting Operation: isolation.gbr') to the G-code.
tooltips.toolChanges: Insert a pause (M0 or M6) when the tool changes between operations. (Not yet implemented)
tooltips.optimize: Applies multiple algorithms to reduce operation time. Disable to try and remove unexpected toolpaths.

parameters.tool: Select a tool from your library. The tool's diameter will be used for calculations.
parameters.toolDiameter: The physical diameter of the cutting tool. This is the most critical value for accurate offsets.
parameters.passes: Number of offset passes to create. More passes clear more copper but take longer.
parameters.stepOver: Percentage of the tool diameter to overlap on each pass. 50% is a good default.
parameters.combineOffsets: Merge all offset passes into a single geometry. Reduces G-code complexity but loses individual pass control.
parameters.millHoles: If checked, generates circular milling paths inside any drill holes larger than the tool. If unchecked, generates a simple peck/drill at the center.
parameters.cutSide: Which side of the cutout line to place the tool. 'Outside' is standard for cutting a board out.
parameters.cutDepth: Final target depth for all cuts, relative to the material surface (Z=0). Should be a negative value (e.g., -0.05mm).
parameters.depthPerPass: Incremental depth of each pass when using multi-depth cutting. Smaller = gentler on tool.
parameters.multiDepth: Enable multiple passes at different depths for deep cuts. Reduces tool stress.
parameters.feedRate: Speed at which the tool moves while cutting (mm/min or in/min).
parameters.plungeRate: Speed at which the tool descends into material (mm/min or in/min). Usually slower than feed rate.
parameters.spindleSpeed: Rotation speed of the spindle (RPM). Higher speeds for smaller tools.
parameters.spindleDwell: Time in seconds to wait after starting the spindle (M3) before moving. Essential high inertia spindles that need extra time to spin up.
parameters.direction: Climb milling: tool rotation matches feed direction (better finish). Conventional: opposite direction (more stable).
parameters.entryType: How the tool enters the material. Plunge: straight down. Ramp: diagonal. Helix: spiral down.
parameters.cannedCycle: Pre-programmed drill cycle. G83 (peck drilling) retracts periodically to clear chips.
parameters.peckDepth: Depth to drill before retracting when using peck drilling. Smaller = more retracts = cleaner holes.
parameters.dwellTime: Pause duration at bottom of hole (seconds). Allows chips to clear and reduces burrs.
parameters.retractHeight: Height to retract to between holes. Should clear board but minimize travel time.
parameters.tabs: Number of small tabs to leave uncut, holding the board in place.
parameters.tabWidth: The length of each holding tab in mm.
parameters.tabHeight: The thickness of the tab. A value of -0.5mm on a -1.8mm cut will leave a 0.5mm thick tab.
parameters.startCode: Custom G-code to add to the beginning of this operation's toolpath.
parameters.endCode: Custom G-code to add to the end of this operation's toolpath.

originControls.originOffset: Manually preview a new X/Y origin. Click 'Apply Origin' to save this position as the new (0,0).
originControls.boardRotation: Apply a rotation (in degrees) to all operations around the current origin.

machineSettings.pcbThickness: The total thickness of your PCB material (e.g., 1.6mm). Used for cutout depth calculations.
machineSettings.safeZ: Maximum safe height for rapid moves and tool changes (G0). Must clear all clamps and fixtures.
machineSettings.travelZ: Height above the board (Z=0) where the tool travels between cutting paths.
machineSettings.rapidFeed: The feed rate (mm/min) for G0 rapid movements (travel and safe Z moves).
machineSettings.postProcessor: Selects the G-code dialect for your specific CNC controller (Non-Grbl modules need more testing, use with caution).
machineSettings.gcodeUnits: Sets the units for the exported G-code file (G21 for mm, G20 for inches).

vizPanel.grid: Toggle the visibility of the canvas grid.
vizPanel.wireframe: Render all geometry as thin outlines instead of filled shapes.
vizPanel.boardBounds: Show a box representing the total size of all loaded files.
vizPanel.rulers: Show/hide the rulers around the canvas.
vizPanel.offsets: Show/hide the calculated offset geometry. This is automatically hidden when a Preview is generated.
vizPanel.previews: Show/hide the toolpath previews, which represent the actual path of the tool.
vizPanel.fusionMode: Merge all overlapping isolation/clearing geometry. Required for Arc Reconstruction.
vizPanel.preprocessed: Shows the geometry *after* fusion but *before* arc reconstruction. Requires Fusion Mode.
vizPanel.arcReconstruction: Attempt to rebuild arcs from line segments in fused geometry. Requires Fusion Mode.
vizPanel.debugPoints: Show all individual points in all geometry.
vizPanel.bwMode: Render the canvas in black and white, ignoring layer colors.
vizPanel.verboseDebug: Show 'debug' level messages in the status log panel. Requires a page reload to see startup messages.

gcode.order: Drag and drop operations to set the final cutting order.
gcode.postProcessor: Overrides the global machine post-processor for this export only.
gcode.singleFile: Combine all selected operations into one G-code file. If unchecked, you will get one file per operation.
gcode.includeComments: Add human-readable comments (e.g., '; Starting Operation: isolation.gbr') to the G-code.
gcode.toolChanges: Insert a pause (M0 or M6) when the tool changes between operations. (Not yet implemented)
gcode.optimize: Applies multiple algorithms to reduce operation time. Disable to try and remove unexpected toolpaths.
gcode.filename: The name of the G-code file that will be downloaded.
gcode.calculate: Process the selected operations and generate the G-code preview based on the current order and settings.
